div.p: [In the fifteenth year of Emperor Caesar Gaius Aurelius] Valerius Diocletian and [fourteenth year of Emperor Caesar Marcus Aurelius Valerius Maximianus Pii Felices Augusti and] seventh year of our lords [Flavius Valerius Constantius and Galerius Valerius Maximianus, the most noble Caesars, in the consulship of . . . in] Ptolemais Euergetis [in the Arsinoite nome. NN acknowledges to NN from the village of -a]delphia, acting without a guardian [by right of the ius liberorum] . . . slaves . . . for their provisions . . . with every guarantee, which NN will also hand over unencumbered . . . the same Plutammon . . . that NN will immediately thwart . . . [(Hd. 2?)] . . . acting [without a guardian] by right of the ius liberorum . . . (Hd. 3?) . . . .
